alert.note: Alert for Clarke; Monroe; Wilcox (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued February 03 at 3:51PM CST until February 03 at 4:45PM CST by NWS Mobile
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mobile has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Monroe County in south central Alabama... Northeastern Clarke County in southwestern Alabama... Wilcox County in south central Alabama... * Until 445 PM CST. * At 350 PM CST, a severe thunderstorm was located near Yellow Bluff, or 8 miles southwest of Camden, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Thomasville, Camden, Grove Hill, Pine Hill, Vredenburgh, Fulton, Yellow Bluff and Pine Apple. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM CST for south central and southwestern Alabama.
